poem:
Title: "Threading the Rio Nexus"

In Rio's web spun by the serpentine,
Overlooked words, as fragile as morning dew,
Rivaldo's boast now hangs on a headline,
Echoing whispers of an unspeakable view. 

Amidst iron fists, a petal falls,
"Who," they chorus, "turned Marielle to dust?"
The crime and church bells call, 
In God, but mainly in detectives, we trust.
